docs.snippet: The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) has lauded the record lack of draws at the ongoing Asian Cup in Australia, but the absence of tied matches raises questions about the competitiveness of future 24-team expanded editions.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) has lauded the record lack of draws at the ongoing Asian Cup in Australia, but the absence of tied matches raises questions about the competitiveness of future 24-team expanded editions.

headline.main: Is Expansion Good or Bad for Asian Cup?
headline.print_headline: Is Expansion Good or Bad for Asian Cup?

docs.snippet: Williams, an 18-time major winner, did not show any first-round jitters, and Djokovic, a four-time Australian Open champion, shrugged off a cold in matches on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Williams, an 18-time major winner, did not show any first-round jitters, and Djokovic, a four-time Australian Open champion, shrugged off a cold in matches on Tuesday.

headline.main: Serena Williams and Novak Djokovic Advance Easily at Australian Open

docs.snippet: Alberto Nisman was working hard to prepare for a congressional hearing on his claim that Argentina's president tried to  whitewash Iran's alleged involvement in a bombing that killed 85 people, a make-or-break day in his career as prosecutor.
docs.lead_paragraph: Alberto Nisman was working hard to prepare for a congressional hearing on his claim that Argentina's president tried to  whitewash Iran's alleged involvement in a bombing that killed 85 people, a make-or-break day in his career as prosecutor.

headline.main: Spies, Lies and Death: Plot Thickens in Argentine Scandal
headline.print_headline: Spies, Lies and Death: Plot Thickens in Argentine Scandal

docs.snippet: Barcelona are not concerned about Luis Suarez's lack of goals in his first few months in Spain and are confident the Uruguay forward will rediscover his scoring touch soon, coach Luis Enrique said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Barcelona are not concerned about Luis Suarez's lack of goals in his first few months in Spain and are confident the Uruguay forward will rediscover his scoring touch soon, coach Luis Enrique said on Friday.

headline.main: Luis Enrique Brushes Off Concern About Suarez Form
headline.print_headline: Luis Enrique Brushes Off Concern About Suarez Form

docs.snippet: The first journalist to report on the death of a Argentine state prosecutor, who was investigating the deadly 1994 bombing of a Jewish community center in Buenos Aires, said on Saturday that he had fled Argentina fearing for his life.
docs.lead_paragraph: The first journalist to report on the death of a Argentine state prosecutor, who was investigating the deadly 1994 bombing of a Jewish community center in Buenos Aires, said on Saturday that he had fled Argentina fearing for his life.

headline.main: Journalist Who Broke News of Prosecutor's Death Flees Argentina
headline.print_headline: Journalist Who Broke News of Prosecutor's Death Flees Argentina

docs.snippet: Damián Pachter, who broke the story of the death of an official investigating the bombing of a Jewish center, said he was being followed.
docs.lead_paragraph: Damián Pachter, who broke the story of the death of an official investigating the bombing of a Jewish center, said he was being followed.

headline.main: Journalist Who Reported on Argentine Prosecutor’s Death Flees to Israel
headline.print_headline: Journalist Who Reported on Argentine Prosecutor’s Death Flees to Israel

docs.snippet: Argentina’s president, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, accused rogue factions of trying to sabotage a deal with Iran to investigate a 1994 bombing that the prosecutor, Alberto Nisman, was looking into.
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina’s president, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, accused rogue factions of trying to sabotage a deal with Iran to investigate a 1994 bombing that the prosecutor, Alberto Nisman, was looking into.
docs.abstract: Argentinian Pres Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announces that she will ask Congress to dissolve Intelligence Secretariat so it can be replaced with new agency with curtailed surveillance powers; move is response to mysterious death of prosecutor Alberto Nisman, who was conducting inquiry into 1994 attack on Jewish center; Kirchner blames rogue elements within intelligence agency for impeding agreement with Iran to jointly investigate attack.

headline.main: Argentine Leader Attacks Spy Agency Amid Furor Over Prosecutor’s Death
headline.print_headline: Argentine Leader Attacks Spy Agency Amid Furor Over Prosecutor’s Death

byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.
byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and JONATHAN GILBERT

docs.snippet: Chilean lawmakers gave final approval on Wednesday to a bill that recognizes civil unions between same-sex couples.

headline.print_headline: Chilean Lawmakers Approve Same-Sex Civil Unions

docs.snippet: Michael Laudrup could quit coaching in a year, with the Dane reluctant to grow old on the bench after turning 50 last June, the former Barcelona and Real Madrid playmaker told Reuters.

headline.main: Laudrup Eyes Retirement Despite Qatar Success

docs.snippet: Paris St Germain reduced Olympique Lyonnais' Ligue 1 lead to one point after Ezequiel Lavezzi's first-half strike earned the  champions a 1-0 home win over Stade Rennes on Friday.
